news_header: The European Union has announced a €200 billion funding program for artificial intelligence (AI) to compete with the US and China, which are leading in AI development.
news_original_title: German AI on the cutting edge, but commercially at a loss
news_text: Experts like Björn Ommer and Katharina Morik emphasize the need for Germany to focus on specialized AI applications rather than just foundation models dominated by US and Chinese companies. They highlight the potential in sectors like medicine and manufacturing, while also warning about the brain drain of AI talent to the US. Morik calls for a cultural shift in Germany to foster AI innovation and retain talent.
